trial_identification.studytitle: Study Evaluating Safety & Immunogenicity of rLP2086 Vaccine in Adolescents
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Randomized, Observer-blinded, Parallel-group, Active-control, Phase Â½ Trial Of The Safety, Immunogenicity, And Tolerability Of 20 Mg, 60 Mg, And 200 Mg Of Meningococcal Group B Rlp2086 Vaccine In Healthy Children And Adolescents Aged 8 To 14 Years

primaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of Participants With Seroconversion in rLP2086 Specific Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer 1 Month After Dose 2
Percentage of Participants With Seroconversion in rLP2086 Specific SBA Titer 1 Month After Dose 3
Percentage of Participants With at Least One Adverse Event (AE)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Dose 1 up to 1 month after Dose 3

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
Inclusion Criteria
- Aged 8 to 14 years at the time of enrollment.
- Healthy male or female subjects
- Negative urine pregnancy test for female subjects
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
Exclusion Criteria
- Prior vaccination with a meningococcal B vaccine
- Prior meningococcal disease

recruitment.hospital: The Children's Hospital at Westmead - Westmead
Princess Margaret Hospital for Children - Subiaco
Sir Albert Sakzewski Virus Research Centre (SASVRC) - Herston
The Telethon Institute for Child Health Research - Subiaco
Department of Paediatrics and Child Health - Woden

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Study to evaluate the safety of an investigational meningitis vaccine and the immune response to it in adolescents
